identification_details: Are walls, ceilings, and doors free from flaking paint or plaster?
vital_signs: Are all equipment made of non-toxic material and free from rust?
surgery: Is potable/drinking water used wherever it comes in contact with food or is used in food preparation?
complaints_communicated: Is proper ventilation and lighting provided within the premises?
intake: Is there a separate storage facility for raw materials, processed food, and packing material?
output: Is all food stored properly in clean, closed containers, away from moisture and sunlight, with perishable foods kept at the right temperature in the refrigerator and FIFO followed?
allergies: Are adequate facilities provided for hand washing, pot washing, and toilets, segregated from food handling areas to prevent cross-contamination?
medication: Is cleaning of equipment, food premises, surrounding areas, and drains done regularly, with timely pest control and no signs of pest activity?
diagnostic: Is food material and water tested periodically in FSSAI-notified labs, and are records maintained?
lab_results: Is raw material procured only from licensed or registered suppliers, and is the date of expiry checked before use?
pending_investigation: Are cutlery, crockery, and utensils made of food-grade materials like ceramic or stainless steel, and are microwave-safe materials used for heating?
medicine_order: Is garbage removed timely to avoid accumulation, and are garbage bins covered and kept clean?
facility_communicated: Is there segregation of vegetarian and non-vegetarian food?
health_education: Is there segregation of raw and cooked food?
risk_assessment: Are persons suffering from disease, illness, or having open wounds or burns excluded from food handling?
urethral: Do food handlers maintain personal hygiene such as clean hands, short clean nails, appropriate clothes, neatly tied or combed hair, and use gloves or aprons as required?
urine_sample: Does the food establishment have an updated FSSAI license, and is it displayed at a prominent location?
bystander: Does the design of the food premises provide adequate working space and allow for maintenance and cleaning to prevent the entry of dirt, dust, and pests?
instruments: Are the internal structure and fittings made of non-toxic and impermeable materials?
sterile: Are walls, ceilings, and doors free from flaking paint, plaster, condensation, and shedding particles?
antibiotics: Are floors non-absorbent, non-slippery, and appropriately sloped?
surgical_site: Are windows kept closed or fitted with insect-proof screens when opening to the external environment?
wound: Are doors smooth, non-absorbent, and have suitable precautions been taken to prevent the entry of pests?
documented: Are equipment and containers made of non-toxic, impervious, and non-corrosive materials, and are they easy to clean and disinfect?
adequate_facilities: Are adequate facilities provided for heating, cooling, refrigeration, and freezing food, and is temperature monitoring facilitated?
sufficient_lighting: Does the premise have sufficient lighting, and are lighting fixtures protected to prevent contamination upon breakage?
storage_facility_for_food: Is there an adequate storage facility for food, packaging materials, chemicals, and personal items?
personnel_hygiene_facilities: Are personnel hygiene facilities available, including an adequate number of handwashing facilities, toilets, and changing rooms for employees?
food_material_testing: Is food material tested either through an internal laboratory or an accredited lab, and are records checked?
incoming_material: Is incoming material procured as per internally laid-down specifications from approved vendors, and are records maintained?
raw_materials_inspection: Are raw materials like vegetables, fruits, and eggs inspected upon receipt for food safety hazards and accepted only if in good condition?
storage_of_materials: Are incoming materials and final products stored hygienically at the required temperature to avoid deterioration and protect from contamination, following FIFO and FEFO practices?
raw_materials_cleaning: Are all raw materials cleaned thoroughly before food preparation?
equipment_sanitization: Is all equipment adequately sanitized before and after food preparation?
frozen_food_thawing: Is frozen food thawed hygienically, with meat, fish, and poultry thawed at 5°C or below, and shellfish/seafood thawed in cold running water within 90 minutes?
vegetarian_and_non_vegetarian: Are vegetarian items cooked to at least 60°C for 10 minutes or 65°C for 2 minutes, and non-vegetarian items cooked to at least 65°C for 10 minutes or 70°C for 2 minutes or 75°C for 15 seconds?
cooked_food_cooling: Is cooked food intended for refrigeration cooled appropriately, from 60°C to 21°C within 2 hours and then to 5°C within another 2 hours?
food_portioning: Is food portioned in hygienic conditions, with high-risk food portioned in a refrigerated area or within 30 minutes, and large amounts kept below 15°C?
temperature_control: Is hot food held at 65°C, non-vegetarian food at 70°C, cold food at 5°C or below, and frozen products at -18°C or below, with strict temperature controls for up to 42 hours?
reheating_food: Is reheating done appropriately, ensuring the core temperature reaches 75°C and is reheated for at least 2 minutes without using indirect methods like hot water or bain-marie?
oil_suitability: Is the oil used suitable for cooking, with periodic verification of its quality through checks on color, flavor, and floating elements?
vehicles_for_food: Are vehicles used for food transportation kept clean, maintained in good repair, and capable of maintaining required temperatures (hot food at 65°C, cold food at 5°C, and frozen items at -18°C during transport)?
food_non_food_separation: Are food and non-food products adequately separated during transportation to avoid contamination?
cutlery_crockery: Are cutlery, crockery, and dining accompaniments clean, sanitized, and free from unhygienic matter?
packaging_material_quality: Is packaging and wrapping material that comes in contact with food clean and of food-grade quality?
equipment_cleaning: Is cleaning of equipment and food premises done according to a scheduled program, with no stagnation of water in food zones?
pm_of_equipment: Is preventive maintenance of equipment and machinery carried out regularly as per manufacturer instructions, with records available?
measuring_devices: Are measuring and monitoring devices calibrated periodically?
pest_control_program: Is there a pest control program in place, with activities carried out by trained personnel, and records maintained?
drain_design: Are drains designed to handle expected flow loads and equipped with grease and cockroach traps to capture contaminants and pests?
food_waste_removal: Is food waste and refuse removed periodically from food handling areas to prevent accumulation?
food_handler_medical: Are food handlers given annual medical exams and inoculated against enteric diseases as per the vaccine schedule, with records available?
ill_individual_exclusion: Are individuals suffering from illness, open wounds, or burns excluded from handling food or materials that come into contact with food?
food_handler_personal: Do food handlers maintain personal cleanliness (clean clothes, trimmed nails, waterproof bandages) and appropriate behavior (handwashing, no loose jewelry, no smoking, no spitting)?
food_handler_protection: Are food handlers provided with suitable aprons, gloves, headgear, etc., where necessary?
consumer_complaints: Does the food business have an effective consumer complaints redressal mechanism?
food_handler_training: Are food handlers properly trained and equipped with the necessary knowledge and skills to handle food safely, with training records available?
documentation_and_records: Are appropriate documentation and records maintained for at least one year or as required?
tables_and_chairs: Are tables and chairs kept clean?
waiting_time_for_food: Is the waiting time for food supplies acceptable?
inpatient_food_schedule: Is the time for inpatient food supplies followed as per the schedule?
use_of_banned_synthetic: Is there any use of banned synthetic substances in food?
vegetable_oil: Do food service establishments on campus ensure that vegetable oil with Total Polar Compound (TPC) over 25% is not used, and are staff trained to use and clean the TPC meter or follow SOP checks?
used_oil_disposal: Do food service establishments on campus maintain used cooking oil disposal records as per FSSAI guidelines if consumption exceeds 50 liters/day, and store used oil separately from fresh oil with proper labeling?
used_oil_collection: Do food service establishments on campus ensure that used cooking oil is collected by authorized aggregators for repurposing into biodiesel?
monitoring_food_waste: Do food service establishments on campus monitor daily food waste (dry and wet) in kgs and conduct food waste audits?
food_waste_reduction: Do food service establishments on campus use methods to reduce food waste, such as offering small portion sizes, using food before it spoils, and procuring only as needed?
food_waste_recycling: Is food waste collected separately and recycled, reused, or repurposed into compost or another reusable form on campus?
surplus_food: Is surplus food that is safe for consumption shared with those in need, either directly or through food collection agencies like the Indian Food Sharing Alliance?
plastic_use: Does the campus minimize plastic use by opting for safe, alternate options such as cloth/paper bags, glass bottles, and biodegradable utensils?
waste_collection: Does the campus organize waste collection drives and recycle plastics, cans, paper, etc.?
recycling_and_reusing: Does the campus recycle and reuse water, with treatment if necessary?
awareness_messages: Are awareness messages on Part A, B, and C of the checklist regularly disseminated through posters, WhatsApp messages, emails, and other means on campus?
celebration: Are important days like World Food Day, World Food Safety Day, and World Environment Day celebrated annually on campus for awareness-building?
healthy_food_choices: Are activities organized on campus at least once a month to encourage healthy food choices, such as food adulterant tests, nutritionist counseling, health check-ups, or healthy cooking demos?
encouraging_healthier: Does the campus encourage healthier food choices by placing healthy options in prominent locations, offering gym discounts, providing nutrition info, or subsidizing healthy food options?
feedback_system: Is there a feedback system on campus for suggestions, complaints, and improving food safety, health, and sustainability?
